channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Crystal Palace Park Road SE26 on the north side of L, 21st August
item.description:
Crystal Palace Park Road SE26 on the north side of Lawrie Park Road traffic island central pole light has two polycarbonate flyposters attached with zip tied to it. Google Streetview: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4199538,-0.0615044,3a,75y,42.61h,86.74t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1scTkW4uJSh1tUmmMhLtqpxQ!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D3.258666796103185%26panoid%3DcTkW4uJSh1tUmmMhLtqpxQ%26yaw%3D42.61270607919119!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDgxOS4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Park Road, Crystal Palace, London

item.title: High Street SE20 8RZ (Penge) outside "Bridge House", 21st August
item.description:
High Street SE20 8RZ (Penge) outside "Bridge House" public house (next to Anerley Park junction) is a traffic island – centre pole of said island has two polycarbonate flyposters attached with zip tied to it.

item.title: Elmers End Road BR3 4EL outside house number 153, 21st August
item.description:

item.title: Inappropriate location and use of commercial food and waste bins and refuse, 21st August
item.description:
Hello A new business is using the pavement to store its commercial waste wheelie bins . They are on the street at all times and are full of food waste and attracting fly tipping and general misuse by passers by. They are also blocking the pavement from proper use. These bins should be stored inside the business premises not on the street, they are unsightly, unhygienic and promoting general bad behaviour in the alley including dog and human fouling. The issue has been going on for the past month or so, I have already made one complaint amd not received any feedback or seen any improvement or action. Please see photo as it describes the situation but does not illustrate that pedestrians are forced into the road to pass this corner now or that a wheelchair user could not use this pavement . This urgently needs to be addressed with the business owner and the bins moved or removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shand Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excess Litter, 21st August
item.description:
Bexleyheath Central Library, 2 Townley Road, Bexleyheath: There is a huge amount of litter at the front of the Library where the library’s landscaped area is - around and under the bushes particularly alcohol cans and bottles. My picture attached doesn’t show the extent of the problem however there never appears to be any form of litter removal from the front grounds of the library making it look unkept. Please could the litter be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Townley Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unwanted old furniture left on the public footpath, 21st August
item.description:
37 Cambridge Road. A resident of this property continuously leaves old furniture and rubbish on the pavement, which they should take to the dump. It's dangerous to those with a visual impairment and blocks the pavement. We (the neighbors') have to lift it back onto the forecourt of number 37.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cambridge Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
